components.description:
A purple heart emoji, often used alongside other colored hearts. Frequently used on Twitter in reference to Korean boy band Bangtan Sonyeondan, more commonly known as BTS.

Previously shown as a pink heart in Android 4.4.

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

apple_vendor_description: The purple heart emoji on Apple devices shines with a vibrant, jewel-like amethyst hue, accented by soft, realistic lighting that emphasizes its plush, rounded form. Its smooth gradient and subtle sheen evoke a sense of deep affection, loyalty, and adoration, distinctively rendered through Apple's characteristic 3D design. This emoji is a powerful way to express profound emotional connection and unwavering support in digital conversations across Apple platforms.
